metadata.title: CVE-2021-29984 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Instruction reordering resulted in a sequence of instructions that wouldcause an object to be incorrectly considered during garbage collection.This led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.13, Thunderbird < 91, Firefox ESR <78.13, and Firefox < 91.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
